Event.name: Hiding_objects
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes a <fen>Hidden_object</fen> to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a <fen>Hiding_place</fen> or putting in place an <fen>Obstruction</fen> that screens the object.
<ex>Therefore, as I passed the school, <fex name="Agent">I</fex> <t>hid</t> <fex name="Hidden_object">the gun and holster</fex> <fex name="Hiding_place">in the mailbox</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Agent">Gruenwald</fex> <t>hid</t> <fex name="Hidden_object">the money</fex> <fex name="Place">at a local garbage dump</fex> then retrieved it the following morning.</ex>
<ex>In later books <fex name="Agent">Harry</fex> often tries to <t>hide</t> <fex name="Hidden_object">his scar</fex> <fex name="Obstruction">with his hair</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Obstruction
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The entity that the <fen>Agent</fen> uses to block the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> from being perceptible.
<ex>She <t>shrouded</t> the tub <fex name="Obstruction">with fabric featuring birds and flowers</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Hidden_object
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is the entity which is blocked from view.
<ex>Michael Jackson gave wine to the 13-year-old cancer patient at the center of the molestation charges he's battling but <t>concealed</t> <fex name="Hidden_object">it</fex> inside a Coke can.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Potential_observer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Potential_observer</fen> denotes a person who might perceive the Hidden_object if it was not hidden.
<ex>The wife claims she <t>hid</t> the gun <fex name="poo">from him</fex> but retrieved it after he became abusive.</ex>
Phrases such as "from view" and "from sight" are assumed to indicate that the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is not visible to any <fen>Potential_observer</fen>.
<ex></ex>He <t>hid</t> the motorbike <fex name="poo">from view</fex> under a few nearby bushes. </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> becomes perceptually inaccessible. </def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who causes the Hidden_entity to be not perceptually accessible to potential perceivers.
<ex><fex name="age">The deputy</fex> <t>concealed</t> the bayonet under his coat.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Hiding_place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is placed so as not to be perceptually accessible.
<ex>He had <t>concealed</t> the necklace <fex name="Hiding_place">behind him</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the spatial setting in which the hiding event takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Time</fen> denotes the interval of time during which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> to become hidden from perceptual access.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the occurrence of the hiding event logically follows.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action of the <fen>Agent</fen> that brings about the hiding of the <fen>Hidden_object</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> hopes to bring about by hiding the <fen>Hidden_object</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

lexUnit.name: hide.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put or keep out of sight.

lexUnit.name: conceal.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: prevent from being perceptually accessible

lexUnit.name: mask.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cover so as to diminish perceptually accessibility

lexUnit.name: shroud.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to envelop an object so as to hide it from view

lexUnit.name: camouflage.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: hide by blending the Hidden_object in with its surroundings

lexUnit.name: block.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to hinder the view of an object by putting something in the path of the viewer

lexUnit.name: cover.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to hinder the view of an object by placing something over or upon it
